section.title: General configuration
section.para:
Through
HTTP Proxy General
you can access into the eBox's proxy HTTP general configuration.

At the configuration window, it's possible to enable or disable the eBox proxy, using the upper selection list. Other options are detailed here:
Transparent proxy
If transparent proxy is enabled, every eBox user will use the transparent proxy without noticing it. If it's disabled, you should configure each browser to work through the proxy.
Port
You can assign a proxy port. It will be used by the browsers, inside the network, to connect to Internet.
Content redirection
You can stablish a restriction level to contents with explicit sex and violence items, which will be filtered by the proxy.
Global policy
It is the default policy for the proxy users. Free access, filter contents or deny access can be selected. Later, this policy can be modified for each user and domain where you need an specific behaviour, as it's explained on next sections.

warning.para: If you stablish a configuration which denies access to administration interface from the machines connected to eBox, you should allow the host where you want to connect from, or you could lose the connection with the web interface.

section.title: Allowed and forbidden domain list
section.para:
At
HTTP Proxy Allowed domains
and
HTTP Proxy Denied domains
you can choose the allowed or denied domains for each eBox user. Classification of each domain on the lists is applied before any other proxy option.

So, you just need to add, to the deny access list or allow access list, the desired domains, to apply this option. Write the full domain name, whose default behaviour you need to modify, and make click on the "Add" action icon. You need to write correctly the domain name, a correct example could be: "warp.es".
If you want to remove any domain from the lists, click on the "remove" action button, to erased your desired domain.

section.title: Policy establishment
section.para:
Through
Proxy Policy
it's possible to establish one conection policy for one network object, allowing a different configuration for each newly created objects. This configuration will be applied previously to the eBox global policy for the selected objects.
